thread.title: ETS Train Launched New Route from KL to Padang Besar
thread.title_full: ETS Train Launched New Route from KL to Padang Besar

author: prbuzz.com
title: ETS Train Launched New Route from KL to Padang Besar
text:
Easybook.com wants to announce the new route for the ETS train. The ETS Train service has been a popular vendor with Easybook customers, and therefore adding a new line to the service will be of great convenience for people in the region traveling to Padang Besar. Customers will now find a convenient method of ticketing and traveling to this Thai-Malaysia border region. Easybook has been online for over ten years and has provided booking for all the major express buses and luxury coaches operating in Singapore and peninsular Malaysia, Indonesia, and parts of Thailand. The Electronic Train Service (ETS) has been improving rapidly the past decade, trying to keep up with the demand from a more sophisticated customer base. Not only are new lines constantly being added to the service, but the trains themselves have become more accessible, cleaner, and more enjoyable from the customer perspective.
“This is certainly good news for our customers,” Spokesperson William explains. “It's an important addition for travelers, being able to get from KL to Pedang Besar. Now, they can purchase a Malaysia ETS train ticket that will take them all the way to the Thai border region and back again so this is a great new route for our customers. We expect to see a lot more ticketing to that region in the upcoming weeks. ”
Along the route of KL to Padang Besar, the ETS train service would also offers stopping points includes Tanjung Malim, Tapah Road, Kampar, Ipoh, Kuala Kangsar, Taiping, Parit Buntar, Bukit Mertajam, Butterworth, Sungai Petani, Alor Setar, Arau and finally to Padang Besar. Easybook.com is a great service for travelers in the Singapore-Malaysia-Thailand regions. This encompassing service offers bus, train, ferry, tour, and car booking all online, quickly, safely, and conveniently. It's numerous options has made the company one of the largest of its kind. Each day customers purchase tickets for over 7500 bus departures, train services, and ferries to their desired destinations throughout Singapore and Malaysia. The site offers passes for coaches to and from major airports, ferries to islands, electronic trains, buses, and other forms of transportation for people who live in the region and those visiting. The website offers user-friendly ticketing where customers can choose from various times, seats, coaches, and sort by prices to find the right choice of travel for them.
Easybook.com is Singapore and Malaysia's preeminent online travel ticketing service, providing travelers easy access to tickets and booking. For more information on the new ETS route or to purchase tickets, visit the website at: http://www.easybook.com/train
